Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic red- or black-figured pottery column-krater with root of handle on right; interior glazed black with added red band around rim; painted decoration on top of rim consisting of part of boar, to left, in silhouette style; part of triangle in black outline on upper right indicating start of handle panel; around edge of rim, debased ivy; underside of overhang and upper most part of neck reserved; exterior of neck glazed black.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1164. For parallels, see the column krater fragment Athens P 25273 in Agora XIII, pl. 46, no. 476 and comments on 161. Venit puts this sherd with British Museum 1886,0401.1164, taking both as red-figure vases dating about 500-490 BC, and suggests that both are by the same hand, and possibly from the same vase as Heidelberg J.65.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 486-7, no. C8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0166) (Phase 1)
